CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 26, 1955, pg. 10, reads: "LEWIS - JAMERSON RECEIVING LINE - Pictured in receiving line at the wedding reception of Mrs. Harriet E. Lewis of Pittsburgh and Dr. J. W. Jamerson of Savannah, Ga., are members of the bridal party and sons and daughters of the couple. Left to right, the newlyweds, Dr. and Mrs. Jamerson; Mrs. Robert L. Vann, matron of honor; Mrs. Jayne Lewis Williams, daughter of the bride; Dr. William Jamerson, son of the groom; Mrs. Adelaide Lewis Scott, daughter of the bride; Dr. and Mrs. Burke Syphax, son-in-law and daughter of the groom, Washington, D. C.; Mrs. Maylaine Jamerson Wallace, Mrs. Dorthea Jamerson Daze, daughters of the groom. D. C., and Robert Lewis, son of the bride. - Harris Photo."  Portions of accompanying article read: "Pittsburgh - Mrs. Harriet E. Lewis was married here Saturday at high noon to Dr. John W. Jamerson of Savannah, Ga., in a solemn high nuptial mass performed by Father Walter H. S. Parker in the austere beauty of Holy Cross Episcopal Church.  The wedding climaxed a round of enchanting pre-nuptial affairs given for the bride, who is the widow of the late Ira F. Lewis.  It was a charming wedding party, which included children of the couple.  The bride, who was given in marriage by her son Robert, chose a chic spring violet suit, made on dressmaker lines, and wore a double corsage of white orchids.  A fascinating orchid feather hat completed her costume.  Attendants - Mrs. Robert L. Vann, matron of honor, chose a svelte rose-beige wool suit, topped with a smart pink flower hat, and wore an orchid corsage.  The bride's two daughters, Mrs. Adelaide Scott and Mrs. Jayne Williams were attendants and were stunning in identical rosy red pencil slim suits with tiny calots to match. Dr. William Jamerson was best man for his father, while Dr. Burke Syphas, son-in-law of the groom, was and usher...Ushers, who were handsome in their morning outfits were Dr. C. C. Blow, Frederick Abels. Dr. Henry Primas, Dr. Robert Bolden and Bailey Williams.  Reception - A reception followed immediately in the church parlors, where the newlyweds greeted some four hundred or more guests.  At 2 o'clock a festive brunch was served at the Greene Hearthe [Hearth] with the bridal aides as hostesses... Dr. and Mrs. Jamerson will be at home at 525 East Henry Street, Savannah, Ga."
TitMainTitle: Women, including Wilhelmina Byrd Brown standing on left, next to receiving line including bride Harriet E. Lewis Jamerson wearing suit and orchid corsage, groom John W. Jamerson wearing morning suit, Jessie Vann, Jayne Lewis Williams, William Jamerson, Adelaide Lewis Scott, Burke Syphax, Mrs. Syphax, Maylaine Jamerson Wallace, Dorthea Jamerson Daze, and Robert Lewis, posed in Holy Cross Episcopal Church
